Red meat: Beef and Lamb NZ rejects Britain’s National Farmers Union ‘lower standards’ claim https://www.nzherald.co.nz/the-country/news/red-meat-beef-and-lamb-nz-rejects-britains-national-farmers-union-lower-standards-claim/XXOPXJSUUZBGHG4WMKJFJMI2X4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/the-country/news/red-meat-beef-and-lamb-nz-rejects-britains-national-farmers-union-lower-standards-claim/XXOPXJSUUZBGHG4WMKJFJMI2X4/ Sally MurphyBritain's National Farmers Union reacted to supermarket Morrisons selling NZ lamb. Mon, 20 May 2024 02:25:33 +0000 NFU livestock board chairman David Barton said NZ lamb was "produced to potentially lower standards". Photo / 123rf
Heavy rain warning among raft of severe weather advisories issued for North Island as subtropical rainmaker bears down https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/severe-weather-warnings-possible-as-heavy-downpours-loom-for-north-island/NY7PIDTWZNFS7NZIKGKYPLPO6U/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/severe-weather-warnings-possible-as-heavy-downpours-loom-for-north-island/NY7PIDTWZNFS7NZIKGKYPLPO6U/ An orange alert is already in place for one region, where up to 160mm could fall. Mon, 20 May 2024 02:07:54 +0000 An orange warning is already in place for Hawke’s Bay, where 120mm to 160mm could fall between 6am Tuesday and 6pm Wednesday - with peak rates potentially reaching 15mm to 25mm an hour tomorrow morning and afternoon. Image / MetService
Wairoa school site returned to iwi as cyclone recovery gathers pace https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/wairoa-school-site-returned-to-iwi-as-cyclone-recovery-gathers-pace/NTLBGU7DWFA3VAFJI5YPZQ3SYM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/wairoa-school-site-returned-to-iwi-as-cyclone-recovery-gathers-pace/NTLBGU7DWFA3VAFJI5YPZQ3SYM/ Doug LaingTuriroa School closed 20 years ago. Now the site will help house the cyclone rebuilders. Mon, 20 May 2024 02:03:46 +0000 Turiroa chairman Daren King signing the Turiroa agreement, with directors (from left) Benita Tahuri, Irah Heyder, Tina Wilcox and Dean Whaanga. Photo / Supplied
Rongoā Māori: Rotorua woman uses traditional healing method for ankle injury https://www.nzherald.co.nz/rotorua-daily-post/news/rongoa-maori-rotorua-woman-uses-traditional-healing-method-for-ankle-injury/QWDKKISFJFDMRCMPUOMBYVMLUI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/rotorua-daily-post/news/rongoa-maori-rotorua-woman-uses-traditional-healing-method-for-ankle-injury/QWDKKISFJFDMRCMPUOMBYVMLUI/ Megan WilsonACC says more than a third of clients using the traditional healing method are non-Māori. Mon, 20 May 2024 02:02:53 +0000 Michelle Van Schadewijk used rongoā Māori to heal from an ankle injury.
Covid-19 vaccine death: Report highlights failures in informing consumers of risks https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/report-highlights-failures-in-informing-consumers-of-risk-following-covid-vaccine-death/F32GOFNBVJAA5MAXCJ2B62VZAM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/report-highlights-failures-in-informing-consumers-of-risk-following-covid-vaccine-death/F32GOFNBVJAA5MAXCJ2B62VZAM/ Shannon PitmanHDC finds failing to provide information was a prima facie breach of the health code. Mon, 20 May 2024 02:01:36 +0000 The commission said Rory Nairn's right to information on the risks of the vaccine was not upheld. Photo / Supplied RNZ
Deputy Health and Disability Commissioner says Te Whatu Ora Waikato did not share patient info, led to early death https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/deputy-health-and-disability-commissioner-says-te-whatu-ora-waikato-did-not-share-patent-info-led-to-early-死亡/JTY35DIKONBB3B73QCQHD7WAUI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/deputy-health-and-disability-commissioner-says-te-whatu-ora-waikato-did-not-share-patent-info-led-to-early-死亡/JTY35DIKONBB3B73QCQHD7WAUI/ Raphael FranksAn X-ray found nodules in lungs, but woman and GP were not told. She died months later. Mon, 20 May 2024 02:00:00 +0000 Te Whatu Ora Waikato failed to pass on critical information about a patient’s X-ray results, resulting in a late cancer diagnosis and an early death, the Deputy Disability Commissioner has found.
Four Far North young people arrested over alleged car-theft sprees https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/four-far-north-youth-arrested-over-alleged-car-theft-sprees/FDQVJAUV6FEZ7F5CRV5L2QULOQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/four-far-north-youth-arrested-over-alleged-car-theft-sprees/FDQVJAUV6FEZ7F5CRV5L2QULOQ/ Mike DinsdaleFar North car-theft sprees ended with arrest of four youths Mon, 20 May 2024 02:00:00 +0000 The car-stealing efforts of four Far North youth are over after allegedly being caught in the act by police last week.
Four youths arrested after aggravated robbery incident at Northland service station https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/four-youths-arrested-after-aggravated-robbery-incident-at-northland-service-station/WPBLBM6AQJAUNBQN4D7RTQF5IE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/four-youths-arrested-after-aggravated-robbery-incident-at-northland-service-station/WPBLBM6AQJAUNBQN4D7RTQF5IE/ Avneesh VincentSpeedy Police response locks in four arrests. Mon, 20 May 2024 00:26:42 +0000 Quick action by Northland Police has landed four people before the courts following an aggravated robbery last night.
Tauranga Harbour suspected diesel spill: Bay of Plenty Regional Council teams investigating https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/tauranga-harbour-suspected-diesel-spill-bay-of-plenty-regional-council-teams-investigating/ES7S7AQXTFCJTIEZAF6W64WKKQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/tauranga-harbour-suspected-diesel-spill-bay-of-plenty-regional-council-teams-investigating/ES7S7AQXTFCJTIEZAF6W64WKKQ/ Rosalie Liddle CrawfordMore to come. Death of Gloriavale’s Sincere Standtrue: Coroner probes man’s sudden death in 2018 https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/death-of-gloriavales-sincere-standtrue-coroner-probes-mans-sudden-death-in-2018/VAIIFFLB6NFWFJ26ZWP2C7KEI4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/death-of-gloriavales-sincere-standtrue-coroner-probes-mans-sudden-death-in-2018/VAIIFFLB6NFWFJ26ZWP2C7KEI4/ Anna LeaskSincere Standtrue died at Chch Hospital in November 2018 after an incident at Gloriavale.
